intro: Cynocrambe japonica, commonly known as Japanese wild radish, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the summer months. The plant is known for its edible roots, which have a spicy, radish-like flavor.
